body_content.explanation: the organ in your chest that sends the blood around your body:
examples: He's got a weak/bad heart (= his heart is not healthy).
Isabel's heart was beating fast with fright.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to a person's character, or the place within a person where feelings or emotions are considered to come from:
examples: She has a good heart (= she is a kind person).
He said he'd never marry but he had a change of heart (= his feelings changed) when he met her.
They say he died of a broken heart (= because he was so sad).
His heart leaped (= he suddenly felt very excited and happy) when the phone rang.

body_content.explanation: the central or most important part:
examples: The demonstrators will march through the heart of the capital.
A disagreement about boundaries is at the heart of the dispute.
Let's get to the heart of the matter.

body_content.explanation: the firm central part of a vegetable, especially one with a lot of leaves:

examples: You're doing really well - don't lose heart now.
Take heart - things can only get better.

body_content.explanation: a shape, consisting of two half circles next to each other at the top and a V shape at the bottom, often coloured pink or red and used to represent love
one of the four suits in playing cards, represented by a red heart shape:
examples: Laura played the queen of hearts and shouted "Snap"!

body_content.explanation: a playing card from the suit of hearts:
examples: In this game, a heart beats a club.

body_content.explanation: used to say that you like someone or something very much:
